intro: Borreria flexuosa, commonly known as the zigzag borage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Borreria flexuosa is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
